page.title: 17 THE BAILEY AT CASTLE CARY
page.content: The Bailey is off Higher Woodcock Street.This round house (bailey) was one of only four in the country and was built in 1779.It was made and bought for 22 pounds by Mr.W.M Clark.The keys are kept at Spearmans,the toy shop in the High street.The round house (bailey)was one of the smallest prisons in the country.There are two doors and two keys,the first is the thickest door with the biggest key,then after that there is a smaller key for a thinner door.The inside is very dull and musty with a stone seat with a hole in the middle,to serve as a toilet.The Bailey is situated off Higher Woodcock Street. It was used for keeping drunks in over night.If you would like more information on the Bailey,there is a library just down the road.
